document.title: Florida Department of Education Adult General Education Curriculum Framework

6AED93C12DF346F3A3C64F7E89D33935.description:
Use context to confirm or
self-correct word recognition
and understanding, rereading
as necessary.

F58689AAA0AF4635B0FB11AEC5BC748B.description:
Read grade-level prose and
poetry orally with accuracy,
appropriate rate, and
expression on successive
readings.

74588A50F74141E28DFCB5C9FF42E277.description:
Read grade-level text with
purpose and understanding.

D09F591672284F1281812AA0C1B01A4B.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Read with sufficient
accuracy and fluency to
support comprehension.

DE48CB20C914445DA7D346197A020E5F.description:
Use context to confirm or
self-correct word recognition
and understanding, rereading
as necessary.

F6D50D1780B64991B468C713BF39B57D.description:
Read grade-level prose and
poetry orally with accuracy,
appropriate rate, and
expression on successive
readings.

4D79F1810479458A81F049AA1480925D.description:
Read grade-level text with
purpose and understanding.

82808C26DC1644159AC6969593852D70.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Read with sufficient
accuracy and fluency to
support comprehension.

CCE80DBFC4C045A1B58C8A3FFEED33C8.description:
Use context to confirm or
self-correct word recognition
and understanding, rereading
as necessary.

A1D27BFAE8184A23B647B51962D6FBD1.description:
Read grade-level text orally
with accuracy, appropriate
rate, and expression on
successive readings

B75BD631FE6149C292D3B3CB037BBCCE.description:
Read grade-level text with
purpose and understanding

25F20E2F1BFB4CA68E6F5C312AA98448.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Read with sufficient
accuracy and fluency to
support comprehension.

DE0638DF619341E4A3C18453194E9356.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. (Fluency)

2272E6C907AB411FA63D57DFA1659FC9.description:
Use combined knowledge
of all letter-sound
correspondences,
syllabication patterns, and
morphology (e.g., roots and
affixes) to read accurately
unfamiliar multisyllabic words
in context and out of context.

DDEF511380804F338286090ED506FF9E.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Know and apply NRS
Level 1 phonics and word
analysis skills in decoding
words.

60896F3F90FE4DB596FC3E43973B1604.description:
Recognize and read gradeappropriate
irregularly spelled
words.

131CF858F9A34842BD18FB03E7612257.description:
Decode words with common
Latin suffixes.

1ED449DDB2014C9593A05BC44B118F6E.description:
Identify words with
inconsistent but common
spelling-sound
correspondences.

584ED4A2ADC74324B63E7EBC6FCB7A20.description:
Identify words with
inconsistent but common
spelling-sound
correspondences

593F14A2F45948DA9E80A20DF9DF90E1.description:
Identify and know the
meaning of the most common
prefixes and derivational
suffixes.

6FB972570ED04BA99B8731814D9D69B0.description:
Know spelling-sound
correspondences for
additional common vowel
teams.

103707B561964988B3E63264842719B5.description:
Distinguish long and short
vowels when reading regularly
spelled one-syllable words.

795185B08C9249389AAE47024E05A134.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Know and apply NRS
Level 1 phonics and word
analysis skills in decoding
words.

A0C796CE942C4A0291CD7E69F0697D43.description:
Recognize and read gradeappropriate
irregularly spelled
words.

E329DA73A49C40E8BA4A69FEA5A5CEAE.description:
Read common highfrequency
words by sight
(e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my,
is, are, do, does).

1CB6F62AA7314749993F740056ADCDA5.description:
Decode two-syllable words
following basic patterns by
breaking the words into
syllables.

55194048E2F44A3EA55D46EF69026FC8.description:
Use knowledge that every
syllable must have a vowel
sound to determine the
number of syllables in a
printed word.

6C7BF65527214F1E98F560CC0458325E.description:
Know final -e and common
vowel team conventions for
representing long vowel sounds.

7B58941535B94B94B93ED2BCBD38E529.description:
Distinguish between
similarly spelled words by
identifying the sounds of the
letters that differ.

44B29188B7C54393A570DAFF57CD8C33.description:
Know the spelling-sound
correspondences for common
consonant digraphs.

2E475F49B8254ADFBE05583648A10710.description:
Associate the long and
short sounds with common
spellings (graphemes) for the
five major vowels

CD3DA692A360401F9670B82B2F891033.description:
Demonstrate basic
knowledge of one-to-one
letter-sound correspondences
by producing the primary
sound or many of the most
frequent sounds for each
consonant.

9EF409BB31FA44DD8EA5F2607EDD86E1.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Know and apply NRS
Level 1 phonics and word
analysis skills in decoding
words.

EA85B5BDE16A4E9790DF5349543BE782.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding
words.

6AFB56DFD23549DAA2CF1B9F780150C2.description:
Add or substitute individual
sounds (phonemes) in simple,
one-syllable words to make
new words.

9CE98E4C6BB6480A8A9560E69DD219EF.description:
Isolate and pronounce
initial, medial vowel, and final
sounds (phonemes) in spoken
single-syllable words.

312CF4B7E64B42E4872969DC7B2B59D1.description:
Segment spoken singlesyllable
words into their
complete sequence of
individual sounds
(phonemes).

5A17B68ADBE94D6198070F88DC111E1D.description:
Orally produce singlesyllable
words by blending
sounds (phonemes), including
consonant blends.

419C78554D2740F3A35BA7F63BD9B04B.description:
Blend and segment onsets
and rimes of single-syllable
spoken words.

5D0E159AA3FE4547997E88A8A0298AFE.description:
Count, pronounce, blend,
and segment syllables in
spoken words.

4FF67E156558476B8B9F0E4D5493ED95.description:
Distinguish long from short
vowel sounds in spoken
single-syllable words.

69FB9F42951F40ECBD0144DA3139B118.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Demonstrate
understanding of spoken
words, syllables, and
sounds.

51B94FCDB6BD4724886451AC21EE8E37.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds
(phonemes). (Phonological Awareness)

65BAD81C379D4792A4A87555B9EF2ADC.description:
Read and
comprehend literary
non-fiction of
appropriate
complexity for NRS
Level 4 complexity.

F7F7267949F94C3A8AA095DE23BFCBB0.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Read and
comprehend
literature, including
stories, dramas, and
poems, of
appropriate
complexity for NRS
Level 4,
independently and
proficiently.

AEA437D94895463EAA40BB878C5A34DD.description:
Read and
comprehend
informational texts,
including
history/social studies,
science and technical
texts, of appropriate
complexity for NRS
Level 3.

F06852EF5B3C4C59830AE83C70802AD1.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Read and
comprehend
literature, including
stories, dramas, and
poetry, of
appropriate
complexity for NRS
Level 3,
independently and
proficiently.

EB42C5BF73484D5892DF7952F86DBC71.description:
Read and
comprehend
informational texts,
including
history/social studies,
science and technical
texts, of appropriate
complexity for NRS
Level 2.

E6F21D1727FF4EBE9ECAEC38B836D70D.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Read and
comprehend
literature, including
stories and poetry,
of appropriate
complexity for NRS
Level 2 proficiently.

019BDC6D409A478E896AD6FD673264F3.description:
Actively engage in
group reading
activities with purpose
and understanding;
with prompting and
support, read
informational text
appropriate for NRS
Level 1.

9BF8FC4CB7334C3397D6F7DE55ED69C4.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Actively
engage in group
reading activities
with purpose and
understanding; with
prompting and
support, read prose
and poetry of
approximate
complexity for NRS
Level 1.

C4A0EAE32EA04991B3AD2E5F4238426F.description:
Read and comprehend complex literary and informational text independently
and proficiently

39998C2AE04840279A1710A29DF717CB.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Analyze a case in
which two or more
texts provide
conflicting information
on the same topic and
identify where the
texts disagree on
matters of fact or
interpretation.

018ECB16ACD24259812C4407739F5BC1.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Integrate
information from
several texts on the
same topic in order
to write or speak
about the subject
knowledgeably.

C1C6B03CC67644DB8986D1FE1A985B58.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Compare and
contrast the most
important points
and key details
presented in two
texts on the
same topic.

44FA25665C60408AA35710F06358CB1E.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Identify basic
similarities in and
differences between
two texts on the
same topic (e.g., in
illustrations,
descriptions, or
procedures).

2E228E7A08764139B8201270E3467C75.description:
Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to
build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take. (Apply this standard to texts of
appropriate complexity as outlined by Standard 10.)

ADCC57DEAFF94A7AB45FD4F5E5AEB1E4.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Delineate and
evaluate the
argument and
specific claims in a
text, assessing
whether the
reasoning is sound
and the evidence is
relevant and
sufficient; recognize
when irrelevant
evidence is
introduced.

B1BB2ED24F4749B8B5DAD222883C42A9.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Explain how an
author uses reasons
and evidence to
support particular
points in a text,
identifying which
reasons and
evidence support
which point(s).

6945556ED8E944D38EA805DFF1F980A0.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Describe how
reasons support
specific points the
author makes in a
text.

CBE66183F3404C8EB29A12843E9F2EC6.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Identify the
reasons an author
gives to support
points in a text.

E573150B43AC4B30AF773D7AAF61ACB7.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument an specific claims in a text, including the
validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence. (Apply this
standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outline by Reading Standard 10.)

DC707C9FAEED41F6B38779A5E4515B5C.description:
Integrate
quantitative or
technical information
expressed in words in
a text with a version
of that information
expressed visually,
such as in a flowchart,
diagram, model,
graph, or table.

B6FEDE7CC4BC4BC6B65815E8A7E4939F.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Integrate
information
presented in
different media or
formats, such as in
charts, graphs,
photographs,
videos, or maps, as
well as in words to
develop a coherent
understanding of a
topic or issue.

D0B4A2C33D744B47B2CEB38EC2F40280.description:
Draw on
information from
multiple print or digital
sources,
demonstrating the
ability to locate an
answer to a question
quickly or to solve a
problem efficiently.

85DA4D8D81F344FEB38DDFF4CD69BDA7.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Interpret
information
presented visually,
orally, or
quantitatively (e.g.,
in charts, graphs,
diagrams, time lines,
animations, or
interactive elements
on Web pages) and
explain how the
information
contributes to an
understanding of
the text in which it
appears.

9C36BC7946E94ABB88AA5530982CDCE0.description:
Explain how
specific aspects of a
text’s illustrations
contribute to what is
conveyed by the
words in a story (e.g.,
create mood,
emphasize aspects of
a character or
setting).

607241EC067C4AB7B47F2F99EAF72EC4.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Use information
gained from
illustrations (e.g.,
maps, photographs)
and the words in a
text to demonstrate
understanding of
the text (e.g., where,
when, why, and how
key events occur).

8C8FC12C88C740FEB1E465C7CFA79DDB.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Use the
illustrations and
details in a text to
describe its key
ideas (e.g., maps,
charts,
photographs,
political cartoons,
etc.).

197A463FFBF4478283E36F21199EB963.description:
Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats,
including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words. (Apply this standard to texts of
appropriate complexity as outlined by Reading Standard 10.)

39834D5B78D9433A942007297E4677A7.description:
Identify aspects of a
text that reveal an
author’s point of view or
purpose (e.g., loaded
language, inclusion or
avoidance of particular
facts).

4351A20102B64752ADB54108B5FBE532.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Determine an
author’s point of view
or purpose in a text and
analyze how the author
acknowledges and
responds to conflicting
evidence or viewpoints.

1BF7F085BEE643668912840CB02EDBB5.description:
Describe how a
narrator’s or
speaker’s point of
view influences how
events are
described.

B919C958EB7F4DA5BDC67D2477356EA5.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Analyze
multiple accounts
of the same event
or topic, noting
important
similarities and
differences in the
point of view they
represent.

CDA58AE4F0E949BFA3B33179A4619EF7.description:
Distinguish their
own point of view
from that of the
author of a text.

CBF8D544B24B43EA9B815D39C2D04741.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Identify the
main purpose of a
text, including what
the author wants to
answer, explain, or
describe.

43D93771C0754877ABB90CBB852FCB5B.description: NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): No Standard at this level

D0CB2836446E4F5D9E4561EEF3916E95.description:
Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
(Apply this standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outlined by Standard 10.)

398F7445B87A445EBB5DE87974170E8C.description:
Analyze the structure
an author uses to
organize a text, including
how the major sections
contribute to the whole
and to the development
of the ideas.

5A99A696A0F04B58B2EDA8C023C004BD.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Analyze how a
particular sentence,
paragraph, chapter, or
section fits into the
overall structure of a
text and contributes to
the development of the
ideas.

1A8B8474C6014117B9CD1257AF3F6BBA.description:
Compare and
contrast the overall
structure (e.g.,
chronology,
comparison,
cause/effect,
problem/solution) of events, ideas,
concepts, or
information in two or
more texts.

ED057A191F824594A09D345ADFC62F2D.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Describe the
overall structure
(e.g., chronology,
comparison,
cause/effect,
problem/solution)
of events, ideas,
information in a
text or part of a
text.

1A6A095ABF5E4AF4A046112B298E8D8F.description:
Use text features
and search tools
(e.g., key words,
sidebars, hyperlinks)
to locate information
relevant to a given topic efficiently.

170814422A72477A85F2F75D0CD3C707.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Know and use
various text
features (e.g.,
captions, bold
print, subheadings,
glossaries,
indexes, electronic
menus, icons) to
locate key facts or
information in a
text efficiently.

F214195931B94680BB3A96EDAED18378.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Know and use
various text
features (e.g.,
headings, tables of
contents,
glossaries,
electronic menus,
icons) to locate key
facts or
information in a
text.

BF44B8FBBB4D4F6AB59483974C457F37.description:
Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs,
and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other
and the whole. (Apply this standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outlined by Standard
10.)

F3053441138C4FB8BB73EBB58D7CF053.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Determine the
meaning of words
and phrases as they
are used in a text,
including figurative,
connotative, and
technical meanings;
analyze the impact
of a specific word
choice on meaning
and tone.

2BDC6E0EF2B74F74ACEB34981646BB93.description:
Determine the
meaning of words and
phrases as they are
used in a text,
including figurative
language such as
metaphors and
similes.

60FA9AC8C4EE4CD381699AF909982776.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Determine the
meaning of general
academic and
domain-specific
words and phrases
in a text relevant to
a topic or subject
area.

2470C20236DD459085C46CEDABBA786E.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Determine the
meaning of general
academic and
domain-specific
words and phrases
in a text relevant to
a topic or subject
area.

4138C4098A6740E38B0355860F2547DB.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Ask and answer
questions to help
determine or clarify
the meaning of
words and phrases
in a text.

9923211BAF9840EAB17376DFD13C13D1.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining
technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape
meaning or tone. (Apply this standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outlined by Standard
10.)

711CF01EC0A14854B102F45B0F12D9B6.description:
Follow precisely a
multistep procedure
when carrying out
experiments, taking
measurements, or
performing technical
tasks.

7ECA6685B81D49AF976745005A023714.description:
Identify key steps
in a text’s description
of a process related
to history/social
studies (e.g., how a
bill becomes law,
how interest rates are
raised or lowered).

3F5CF60B74014F9F80B6BC30F4B1E464.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Analyze how a
text makes
connections among
and distinctions
between individuals,
ideas, or events
(e.g., through
comparisons,
analogies, or
categories).

E83B40E581A144B29A2DA0C3338B8275.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Explain events,
procedures, ideas,
or concepts in a
historical, scientific,
or technical text,
including what
happened and why,
based on specific
information in the
text.

C7DBBE32A76941C0BD5FF41AF5C2B19B.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Describe the
relationship
between a series of
historical events,
scientific ideas or
concepts, or steps
in technical
procedures in a text,
using language that
pertains to time,
sequence, and
cause/effect.

1B72205AAD2241F0BA5FA490759B4C07.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Describe the
connection between
two individuals,
events, ideas, or
pieces of
information in a text.

9C5C7AADE95C4FD18DCBB12E4A08C851.description:
Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over
the course of a text. (Apply this standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outlined by
Standard 10.)

83584184BD6D47CABC162463228BB395.description:
Determine the
central ideas or
conclusions of a text;
provide an accurate
summary of the text
distinct from prior
knowledge or
opinions.

E2C9218648554496AE9DB429E2F1FAAD.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Determine a
theme or central
idea of a text and how it is conveyed
through particular
details; provide a
summary of the text
distinct from
personal opinions
or judgments.

65DD2A9DAB794F93B9A52B9092E1FFDE.description:
Determine a theme
of a story, drama, or
poem from details in
the text; summarize
the text.

F4AA0A126E674E209FB4CD68662A7445.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Determine the
main idea of a text
and explain how it is supported by key
details; summarize
the text.

9844083DA999493CB30E2C2B14E3FBF7.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Determine the
main idea of a text;
recount the key details and explain
how they support
the main idea.

93F93F390AB24CB4AFF8C95629CCF802.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Identify the
main topic and retell
key details of a text.

39E79EF88CAB44919417F1474C44694A.description:
Cite specific textual
evidence to support
analysis of science
and technical texts.

DF4DA25E145E4282B80FE7B3EF77F72E.description:
Cite specific textual
evidence to support
analysis of primary
and secondary
sources.

C9D1E9464E0D489E99BDF22ABCE995CF.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Cite several
pieces of textual
evidence to support
analysis of what the
text says explicitly
as well as
inferences drawn
from the text.

EE5AE88FCA624A4FB619530303064A11.description:
Quote accurately
from a text when
explaining what the
text says explicitly
and when drawing
inferences from the
text.

D7C0492CFFE041FD98991488FA8198D2.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Refer to details
and examples in a
text when explaining
what the text says
explicitly and when
drawing inferences
from the text.

BF5F4FDD53CC43B18357A8F59556005D.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Ask and answer
such questions as
who, what, where,
when, why, and how
to demonstrate
understanding of
key details in a text.

68AC7A49369B4265B7288AE0959F0E4E.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Ask and
answer questions
about key details in
a text.

AC5D0751C92043FFB1A19B6FB9E7C195.description:
Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical
inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions
drawn from the text. (Apply this standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outlined by
Standard 10.)
